factText: Hundreds of coastal North Carolina residents are staying at emergency shelters at Wake County high schools to escape from Hurricane Florence. Almost three dozen emergency shelters — including Columbia, Orangeburg and Sumter schools — have opened for evacuees fleeing from Hurricane Florence.
